description: Creates a cluster in your account. Amazon Web Services PCS creates the cluster controller in a service-owned account. The cluster controller communicates with the cluster resources in your account. The subnets and security groups for the cluster must already exist before you use this API action.

parameters.name: clusterName
parameters.description: A name to identify the cluster. Example: MyCluster.

parameters.name: scheduler
parameters.description: The cluster management and job scheduling software associated with the cluster. The software Amazon Web Services PCS uses to manage cluster scaling and job scheduling. The version of the specified scheduling software that Amazon Web Services PCS uses to manage cluster scaling and job scheduling. For more information, see Slurm versions in Amazon Web Services PCS in the Amazon Web Services PCS User Guide. Valid Values: 23.11 | 24.05 | 24.11

nested_params.name: type
nested_params.description: The software Amazon Web Services PCS uses to manage cluster scaling and job scheduling.

nested_params.name: version
nested_params.description: The version of the specified scheduling software that Amazon Web Services PCS uses to manage cluster scaling and job scheduling. For more information, see Slurm versions in Amazon Web Services PCS in the Amazon Web Services PCS User Guide. Valid Values: 23.11 | 24.05 | 24.11

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: A value that determines the maximum number of compute nodes in the cluster and the maximum number of jobs (active and queued). SMALL: 32 compute nodes and 256 jobs MEDIUM: 512 compute nodes and 8192 jobs LARGE: 2048 compute nodes and 16,384 jobs.

parameters.name: networking
parameters.description: The networking configuration used to set up the cluster's control plane. subnetIds (list) --- The list of subnet IDs where Amazon Web Services PCS creates an Elastic Network Interface (ENI) to enable communication between managed controllers and Amazon Web Services PCS resources. Subnet IDs have the form subnet-0123456789abcdef0. Subnets can't be in Outposts, Wavelength or an Amazon Web Services Local Zone. (string) --- securityGroupIds (list) --- A list of security group IDs associated with the Elastic Network Interface (ENI) created in subnets. (string) ---

nested_params.name: subnetIds
nested_params.description: The list of subnet IDs where Amazon Web Services PCS creates an Elastic Network Interface (ENI) to enable communication between managed controllers and Amazon Web Services PCS resources. Subnet IDs have the form subnet-0123456789abcdef0. Subnets can't be in Outposts, Wavelength or an Amazon Web Services Local Zone.

nested_params.name: securityGroupIds
nested_params.description: A list of security group IDs associated with the Elastic Network Interface (ENI) created in subnets.

parameters.name: slurmConfiguration
parameters.description: Additional options related to the Slurm scheduler. scaleDownIdleTimeInSeconds (integer) --- The time (in seconds) before an idle node is scaled down. Default: 600 slurmCustomSettings (list) --- Additional Slurm-specific configuration that directly maps to Slurm settings. (dict) --- Additional settings that directly map to Slurm settings. Amazon Web Services PCS supports configuration of the following Slurm parameters: For clusters Prolog Epilog SelectTypeParameters For compute node groups Weight RealMemory The values for the configured Slurm settings. accounting (dict) --- The accounting configuration includes configurable settings for Slurm accounting. The default value for mode is STANDARD. A value of STANDARD means Slurm accounting is enabled. defaultPurgeTimeInDays (integer) --- The default value for all purge settings for slurmdbd.conf. For more information, see the slurmdbd.conf documentation at SchedMD. The default value for defaultPurgeTimeInDays is -1. A value of -1 means there is no purge time and records persist as long as the cluster exists.

nested_params.name: scaleDownIdleTimeInSeconds
nested_params.description: The time (in seconds) before an idle node is scaled down. Default: 600

nested_params.name: slurmCustomSettings
nested_params.description: Additional Slurm-specific configuration that directly maps to Slurm settings.

nested_params.name: parameterName
nested_params.description: Amazon Web Services PCS supports configuration of the following Slurm parameters:

nested_params.name: parameterValue
nested_params.description: The values for the configured Slurm settings.

nested_params.name: accounting
nested_params.description: The accounting configuration includes configurable settings for Slurm accounting.

nested_params.name: mode
nested_params.description: The default value for mode is STANDARD. A value of STANDARD means Slurm accounting is enabled.

nested_params.name: defaultPurgeTimeInDays
nested_params.description: The default value for all purge settings for slurmdbd.conf. For more information, see the slurmdbd.conf documentation at SchedMD. The default value for defaultPurgeTimeInDays is -1. A value of -1 means there is no purge time and records persist as long as the cluster exists.

parameters.name: clientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Idempotency ensures that an API request completes only once. With an idempotent request, if the original request completes successfully, the subsequent retries with the same client token return the result from the original successful request and they have no additional effect. If you don't specify a client token, the CLI and SDK automatically generate 1 for you. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: 1 or more tags added to the resource. Each tag consists of a tag key and tag value. The tag value is optional and can be an empty string. (string) --- (string) ---

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name that identifies the cluster.

nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The generated unique ID of the cluster.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The unique Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The provisioning status of the cluster.

nested_items.name: createdAt
nested_items.description: The date and time the resource was created.

nested_items.name: modifiedAt
nested_items.description: The date and time the resource was modified.

nested_items.name: scheduler
nested_items.description: The cluster management and job scheduling software associated with the cluster.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The software Amazon Web Services PCS uses to manage cluster scaling and job scheduling.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version of the specified scheduling software that Amazon Web Services PCS uses to manage cluster scaling and job scheduling. For more information, see Slurm versions in Amazon Web Services PCS in the Amazon Web Services PCS User Guide.

nested_items.name: slurmConfiguration
nested_items.description: Additional options related to the Slurm scheduler.

nested_items.name: scaleDownIdleTimeInSeconds
nested_items.description: The time (in seconds) before an idle node is scaled down.

nested_items.name: slurmCustomSettings
nested_items.description: Additional Slurm-specific configuration that directly maps to Slurm settings.

nested_items.name: parameterName
nested_items.description: Amazon Web Services PCS supports configuration of the following Slurm parameters:

nested_items.name: parameterValue
nested_items.description: The values for the configured Slurm settings.

nested_items.name: secretArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the the shared Slurm key.

nested_items.name: secretVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the shared Slurm key.

nested_items.name: accounting
nested_items.description: The accounting configuration includes configurable settings for Slurm accounting.

nested_items.name: mode
nested_items.description: The default value for mode is STANDARD. A value of STANDARD means Slurm accounting is enabled.

nested_items.name: defaultPurgeTimeInDays
nested_items.description: The default value for all purge settings for slurmdbd.conf. For more information, see the slurmdbd.conf documentation at SchedMD.

nested_items.name: networking
nested_items.description: The networking configuration for the cluster's control plane.

nested_items.name: subnetIds
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet where Amazon Web Services PCS creates an Elastic Network Interface (ENI) to enable communication between managed controllers and Amazon Web Services PCS resources. The subnet must have an available IP address, cannot reside in AWS Outposts, AWS Wavelength, or an AWS Local Zone.

nested_items.name: securityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The list of security group IDs associated with the Elastic Network Interface (ENI) created in subnets.

nested_items.name: endpoints
nested_items.description: The list of endpoints available for interaction with the scheduler.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: Indicates the type of endpoint running at the specific IP address.

nested_items.name: errorInfo
nested_items.description: The list of errors that occurred during cluster provisioning.
